abstract: Trend toward teaching and measuring social-emotional skills in students is met with resistance from experts, who caution such growth is difficult to determine effectively as it often requires self-reporting; supporters tout benefit of relaxing exclusive focus on academic test scores; pilot program currently in use in some California districts highlighted.
lead_paragraph: In a closely watched experiment, students in California are being tested on their social-emotional skills; the results will be used to rate schools.

headline.main: Testing for Joy and Grit? Schools Nationwide Push to Measure Students’ Emotional Skills
headline.print_headline: Testing for Grit? Schools Pushed on Social Skills
